results.title: The Birchip boy who became a legend
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: An intimate portrait of 84-year-old Roger Hogan, aka Australian Country music legend ‘Dusty Rankin’. Born and raised in Birchip, Dusty appeared on Australia’s Amateur Hour in 1946 and maintained an active career through to 1961 when he returned to working the farm full-time. He was one of the most popular country artists of the time, with many of his songs becoming popular standards. Here Roger remembers his rich life of touring but ultimately brings it all back home.
results.title_for_label: The Birchip boy who became a legend
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: Bobby and the Birchip Leisure Centre
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: The Birchip Leisure Centre is the social hub of Birchip township and surrounds. In addition to providing clubrooms for the local football, hockey, netball, golf and tennis clubs, the leisure centre also plays host to social events and functions. What is key to the centre is the fact that it is community built and funded - everyone in the local area collaborated to raise money and build the facilities. Here the manager, Bobby Liston, gives a personal view of this important place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development

results.title: Stories from Birchip
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Ten stories recorded by ACMI in the Mallee town of Birchip (and one about an Art Deco cinema in nearby Charlton) to celebrate the annual Small Towns summit hosted by Birchip in August 2007. Each film created to be a part of the ACMI MAP (Memory and Place) project is under 7 minutes long and is specifically about relationship to place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development

results.title: KOK 28mm hand cranked projector
results.brief_description: In 1912, the popular Pathé Kok camera and projector arrived, which used the more standard 28mm film and cast a 30-inch picture.
results.description:
28mm hand crank projector designed by Pathe. Designed for home use, the Pathe KOK projector uses non-flammable cellulose acetate safety film and an electric light. The projector is powered by a crank handle. Contains: projector, hand crank, metal cover, 2 x metal reels.
Sticker on reel says “The property of Visual Education Centre, Education Dept. Victoria”
See video of same model (modified) of projector in use: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SG9Nvly1UB4
Was ACMI Lending Collection/ACMI Collection in 2014 audit - NR says unclear, but should keep.
28 mm gauge metal projector on wooden base.Object functions.
description_for_label:

results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Home, the old place, Little Dunmore
results.creator_credit: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eileen Alberts remembers the home of her past, her family’s history and her spiritual home. It is the place that has made her the person she is and where she returns to soothe her soul and strengthen her spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Paranoid
results.brief_description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.

results.title: From Melville to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Tristan Mungatopi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: WCSC
results.brief_description:
Tune in as Jerry and Bruce commentate the sports event of the millennium! Rushkov versus Javichenko. Be sure to experience the giddying highs of Friday night WCSC live at Viagro Stadium.
Animated work. Includes animated nudity. Voices - Trent Baker, Simon Philamon. Written, directed and animated by Michael Hill.
